alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 8:33AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Grande Near San Ildefonso Pueblo affecting Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Los Alamos, Rio Arriba and Santa Fe Counties. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows and minor overbank flooding is expected due to any rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...Rio Grande near San Ildefonso Pueblo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding of cultivated lands upstream of the Otowi gage will increase if water levels rise further. Fast flowing water could undermine the river banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.1 feet this evening. It will then rise to 8.2 feet early Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1015 PM MDT.
